intro: Tragia guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. Tragia guyanensis is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
